title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville responded to online criticism by launching 'Bye Bridget' merchandise.
Owner Natalie Hug initiated the merchandise after an internet troll criticized their charity work during anti-ICE protests.
The bakery donates a portion of sales to various charities, with recent causes aiding food banks and immigrant support groups.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kathleen Boucher of Eastham died after falling through the ice at Bee's River on February 14.
Daughter Katy Boucher paid tribute, recalling their community service and urging others to help in their memory.
The Bouchers were active in Eastham since 2008, with Kit volunteering for animal welfare and Jerry aiding seniors.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg homes are being investigated as arson, confirmed by State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Fires occurred on Feb. 14 and 15 at an apartment building with entrances on Blossom and Day streets.
A separate fire on Feb. 18 at a multi-family home on Myrtle Avenue displaced seven people and caused one injury.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria', died of ALS at 53, announced his diagnosis last year.
Dane's acting career spanned roles in 'The Last Ship', 'X-Men: The Last Stand', and advocacy for ALS awareness.
Dane is survived by wife Rebecca Gayheart and daughters Billie and Georgia; memoir scheduled for release in 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged with involuntary manslaughter over 2024 recruit death are suspended with pay.
Enrique Delgado-Garcia, 25, died from blunt-force injuries during a State Police training exercise in September 2024.
Lt. Jennifer Penton is additionally charged with perjury for allegedly lying about knowledge of Delgado-Garcia's symptoms.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police warn of a planned 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza scheduled for Friday evening at 7 p.m.
Officials became aware of the event through a social media post and are coordinating with law enforcement for safety.
Previous takeovers in Massachusetts involved street blockades and confrontations, prompting state legislation and increased police measures.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins sees Celtics as potential 2026 champions if Jayson Tatum returns from Achilles injury.
Boston Celtics sit second in the Eastern Conference with a record of 35-19 despite offseason player losses.
Perkins highlights Jaylen Brown as an MVP contender, praising his two-way game and leadership.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots discussed acquiring Eagles' AJ Brown, offering first, third, and sixth-round 2026 draft picks for Brown and a second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, is under a 3-year, $96 million contract, and has four consecutive 1,000-yard seasons.
Despite a down season with 1,003 yards, AJ Brown remains a top NFL receiver, ranked sixth in ESPN's metrics.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts, with 88 catches in 2025, could enhance the Patriots' passing game for quarterback Drake Maye.
The Patriots need new offensive weapons, considering high costs for players like Alec Pierce and A.J. Brown.
Pitts, projected to cost $17.5 million annually, offers a more budget-friendly option compared to other free agents.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown, pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
Pagnoni was investigated after a tip linked him to distribution of child sexual abuse material via the platform MEGA.
He faces a sentence of up to 20 years in prison per charge, with sentencing set for May 12.
